body_html:
Now it's coming back to me. IIRC, because meta-data information is stored on the host, running operations on GPU was slower because of the overhead. So we have traditionally stayed away from integer operations on GPU. Not sure if that changed.

In your case, you can still cast to int32 where the op is implemented.
body_text:
Now it's coming back to me. IIRC, because meta-data information is stored on the host, running operations on GPU was slower because of the overhead. So we have traditionally stayed away from integer operations on GPU. Not sure if that changed.
In your case, you can still cast to int32 where the op is implemented.
body:
Now it's coming back to me. IIRC, because meta-data information is stored on the host, running operations on GPU was slower because of the overhead. So we have traditionally stayed away from integer operations on GPU. Not sure if that changed.

In your case, you can still cast to int32 where the op is implemented.
